simulation module

simulation.run(nb_runs=10000, N=1000, prop_cancer=0.1, omega=0.2, alpha=0.5, T=20, treatment=True, nb_treatments=5, verbose=True, weighted_reproduction=True, weighted_apoptosis=True, init_clones=3)

Fetch all the parameters given by the user and performs a simulation according to the type of model the user wants.

Parameters

  • nb_runs (int) – Number of iterations of the simulation

  • N (int) – Number of cells within the tissue

  • prop_cancer (double) – initial percentage of cancerous cell in the population

  • omega (double) – percentage of cancerous cells in the whole population at which the tumor can be detected

  • alpha (double) – treatment factor between 0 and 1 that decreases at each iteration the fitness of a cancerous cell that receives the treatment

  • T (int) – max number of generation_time (refer to the :class: tissue.Tissue) for a cell receiving the treatment

  • treatment (boolean) – if the user wants to apply a treatment during the simulation

  • nb_treatment (int) – as a treatment is specific to a clone type, we can apply consecutive treatment, i.e., cure multiple clone types at once.

  • verbose (boolean) – print the status of the simulation

  • weighted_reproduction (boolean) – use the cell fitness to weight the cell division process

  • weighted_apoptosis (boolean) – use the cell fitness to weight the cell apoptosis process

  • init_clones (int) – number of initial clone type we put at the beginning of the simulation
